A1.name: Net Profit / Total Assets
A1.interpretation: Return on Assets (ROA). Higher values indicate better profitability.

A2.name: Total Liabilities / Total Assets
A2.interpretation: Debt ratio. Higher values indicate higher financial leverage and risk.

A3.name: Working Capital / Total Assets
A3.interpretation: Proportion of assets in liquid form. Higher is better for short-term obligations.

A4.name: Current Assets / Short-term Liabilities
A4.interpretation: Current ratio. Values > 1 indicate ability to cover short-term debts.

A5.name: [(Cash + Short-term Securities + Receivables - Short-term Liabilities) / (Operating Expenses - Depreciation)] * 365
A5.formula: [(cash + short-term securities + receivables - short-term liabilities) / (operating expenses - depreciation)] * 365
A5.interpretation: Days of cash coverage. Negative values indicate immediate liquidity problems.

A6.name: Retained Earnings / Total Assets
A6.interpretation: Cumulative profitability. Part of Altman Z-Score.

A7.name: EBIT / Total Assets
A7.interpretation: Operating profitability. Key indicator of core business performance.

A8.name: Book Value of Equity / Total Liabilities
A8.formula: book value of equity / total liabilities
A8.interpretation: Equity cushion. Higher values indicate stronger solvency.

A9.name: Sales / Total Assets
A9.interpretation: Asset turnover efficiency. Higher values indicate better asset utilization.

A10.name: Equity / Total Assets
A10.interpretation: Equity ratio. Complement of debt ratio.

A11.name: (Gross Profit + Extraordinary Items + Financial Expenses) / Total Assets
A11.formula: (gross profit + extraordinary items + financial expenses) / total assets

A12.name: Gross Profit / Short-term Liabilities
A12.interpretation: Ability to cover short-term debt with profits.

A15.name: (Total Liabilities * 365) / (Gross Profit + Depreciation)
A15.interpretation: Days to repay all debt with operating cash. Lower is better.

A16.name: (Gross Profit + Depreciation) / Total Liabilities
A16.interpretation: Operating cash generation relative to debt.

A17.name: Total Assets / Total Liabilities
A17.interpretation: Asset coverage of liabilities. Values > 1 indicate positive equity.

A19.name: Gross Profit / Sales
A19.interpretation: Gross profit margin. Key profitability indicator.

A20.name: (Inventory * 365) / Sales
A20.interpretation: Days inventory outstanding. Lower indicates faster turnover.

A22.name: Profit on Operating Activities / Total Assets
A22.formula: profit on operating activities / total assets

A25.name: (Equity - Share Capital) / Total Assets
A25.interpretation: Retained earnings as proportion of assets.

A26.name: (Net Profit + Depreciation) / Total Liabilities
A26.interpretation: Cash generation relative to debt burden.

A27.name: Profit on Operating Activities / Financial Expenses
A27.formula: profit on operating activities / financial expenses
A27.interpretation: Interest coverage ratio. Higher values indicate ability to service debt.

A29.name: Logarithm of Total Assets
A29.interpretation: Company size. Larger firms may have different risk profiles.

A30.name: (Total Liabilities - Cash) / Sales
A30.interpretation: Net debt burden relative to revenue.

A32.name: (Current Liabilities * 365) / Cost of Products Sold
A32.interpretation: Days payable outstanding. Payment cycle to suppliers.

A33.name: Operating Expenses / Short-term Liabilities
A33.interpretation: Operating expense burden relative to short-term debt.

A34.name: Operating Expenses / Total Liabilities
A34.interpretation: Operating expense burden relative to total debt.

A35.name: Profit on Sales / Total Assets
A35.interpretation: Sales profitability relative to asset base.

A36.name: Total Sales / Total Assets
A36.interpretation: Asset turnover. Efficiency of asset utilization.

A37.name: (Current Assets - Inventories) / Long-term Liabilities
A37.interpretation: Quick assets coverage of long-term debt.

A40.name: (Current Assets - Inventory - Receivables) / Short-term Liabilities
A40.interpretation: Most conservative liquidity ratio. Only cash and equivalents.

A41.name: Total Liabilities / ((Profit on Operating Activities + Depreciation) * (12/365))
A41.formula: total liabilities / ((profit on operating activities + depreciation) * (12/365))
A41.interpretation: Months of operating cash needed to repay all debt.

A42.name: Profit on Operating Activities / Sales
A42.interpretation: Operating profit margin. Core business profitability.

A43.name: Rotation Receivables + Inventory Turnover in Days
A43.formula: rotation receivables + inventory turnover in days
A43.interpretation: Total operating cycle length. Lower is better.

A46.name: (Current Assets - Inventory) / Short-term Liabilities
A46.interpretation: Quick ratio. Liquidity without relying on inventory sales.

A47.name: (Inventory * 365) / Cost of Products Sold
A47.interpretation: Days inventory outstanding based on COGS.

A48.name: EBITDA (Profit on Operating Activities - Depreciation) / Total Assets
A48.formula: EBITDA (profit on operating activities - depreciation) / total assets

A49.name: EBITDA (Profit on Operating Activities - Depreciation) / Sales
A49.formula: EBITDA (profit on operating activities - depreciation) / sales

A50.name: Current Assets / Total Liabilities
A50.interpretation: Short-term assets coverage of all liabilities.

A51.name: Short-term Liabilities / Total Assets
A51.interpretation: Proportion of assets funded by short-term debt.

A54.name: Constant Capital / Fixed Assets
A54.interpretation: Permanent capital funding of fixed assets.

A55.name: Working Capital
A55.interpretation: Absolute working capital. Current assets minus current liabilities.

A57.name: (Current Assets - Inventory - Short-term Liabilities) / (Sales - Gross Profit - Depreciation)
A57.formula: (current assets - inventory - short-term liabilities) / (sales - gross profit - depreciation)
A57.interpretation: Days company can operate without additional cash inflow.

A60.name: Sales / Inventory
A60.interpretation: Inventory turnover ratio. Higher indicates faster movement.

A61.name: Sales / Receivables
A61.interpretation: Receivables turnover. Higher indicates faster collection.

A64.name: Sales / Fixed Assets
A64.interpretation: Fixed asset turnover. Efficiency of long-term assets.

Profitability.description: Ratios measuring company's ability to generate profit

Liquidity.description: Ratios measuring company's ability to meet short-term obligations

Leverage.description: Ratios measuring company's debt and capital structure
